page.title: 01GENERAL IMPRESSIONS.
page.content: The area we have been looking at is mostly farming country.The land is not top quality and so much of it is layed to pasture for sheep and calf rearing. The word{Spreyton}where most of us live,means{"Farm in the Brushwood." Spreyton is the highest village in Devon,off the moor,above sea level.The church tower used to be painted white so that it could be seen from the Bristol Channel. Thomas Cobley of the famous song was born here in 1762 and became known as Uncle Tom Cobley. His grave can be} seen in the churchyard.He died in 1844 Since the arrival of the new A30 to Whiddon Down and the planned extension to by-pass Okehampton, Exeter and beyond is easy to get to and so more } people are moving in. The pretty thatched houses and others are being sold to people who work in towns.
